item.title: Technology and Choice #08, Porcfest Potpourri
item.description:
Technology and Choice #08, Porcfest Potpourri

In this Episode A few days at the Porcupine Freedom Festival in New Hampshire netted a load of wonderful connections, some very interesting insights and a few very relevant interviews, from the perspective of the technology and choice pair. First up in this episode is Sam Patterson, Chief Operating Officer of OB1, the company developing the Open Bazaar protocol and ecosystem.

item.title: China Signals a New, Accepting Approach to Digital Currencies
item.description:
China Signals a New, Accepting Approach to Digital Currencies

China's government has signaled that it is warming up to digital currency with a new proposed civil law that may recognize people's legal right to own virtual assets, including digital currencies. A new draft of China's civil code was introduced in The National People's Congress June 27.

item.title: Paris Politician Wants to Ban Bitcoin
item.description:
Paris Politician Wants to Ban Bitcoin

Paris politician Bernard Debré, the deputy of the National Assembly of France and a member of the Union for a Popular Movement in Paris, has stated that Bitcoin should be banned in the city, according to a local report.

item.title: Decentralized Storage Platform Sia Launches Beta
item.description:
Decentralized Storage Platform Sia Launches Beta

The decentralized storage platform Also read: Buyer Beware! The Definitive OneCoin Ponzi Exposé Sia has announced it will release its beta version shortly with a graphical user interface (GUI) and an instant wallet. The project has been anticipated since late 2015 since the developing team launched the project, which is similar to concepts such as Filecoin and Storj .

item.title: Optimizing the Power Usage of AMD Radeon RX 480 for Ethereum Mining
item.description:
Optimizing the Power Usage of AMD Radeon RX 480 for Ethereum Mining

If you have checked our publication Testing the AMD Radeon RX 480 for Ethereum Mining you should already know that at the moment you are a bit limited in your capabilities of reducing the power usage of the new RX 480 GPUs.

item.title: Why Ethereum Needs 'Dumb' Contracts - CoinDesk
item.description:
Why Ethereum Needs 'Dumb' Contracts - CoinDesk

Daniel Cawrey is head of communications at Velocity, an autonomous derivatives project utilizing smart contracts and built on the ethereum blockchain. In this opinion piece, Cawrey discusses the recent demise of The DAO and how that impacts the future of smart contracts, the technology on which the short-lived fund was based.

item.title: [bitcoin-dev] Even more proposed BIP extensions to BIP 0070
item.description:
[bitcoin-dev] Even more proposed BIP extensions to BIP 0070

On Tue, Jun 21, 2016 at 05:14:31PM -0700, Justin Newton wrote: > On Tue, Jun 21, 2016 at 3:13 PM, Peter Todd via bitcoin-dev Hi Peter, > Certainly AML/KYC compliance is one of the use cases that BIP 75 and our > certificates can support.

item.title: Episode 708: Bitcoin Divided
item.description:
Episode 708: Bitcoin Divided

Bitcoin was supposed to be the currency of the future: secure, fast, independent of any government. But if there's one feature a currency needs, it's to let you pay for things. And, recently, that's been a problem for Bitcoin. The idea was always that when technical problems arose, the bitcoin community would come together to solve things.

item.title: How China Took Center Stage in Bitcoin's Civil War
item.description:
How China Took Center Stage in Bitcoin's Civil War

He said the American companies failed to understand the power dynamics in the room that day. "It was almost like imperialistic Westerners coming to China and telling us what to do," Mr. Lee said in an interview last week. "There has been a history on this. The Chinese people have long memories."

item.title: Ethereum's Soft Fork Called Off as it Introduces a New Attack Vector - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Ethereum's Soft Fork Called Off as it Introduces a New Attack Vector - NEWSBTC

The Ethereum Foundation has introduced a new Geth client version (1.4.9) that rolls back the changes made in the previous soft-fork-enabled software. A security alert was issued by Ethereum Foundation. In the announcement, the developer Felix Lange explained: An attack vector has been identified in the freshly released implementation of the DAO soft fork.
